title: Sheet Pan Meatloaf Recipe
description: A basic recipe for sheet pan meatloaf served with a tasty homemade barbecue glaze.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Meatloaf Recipes Beef Meatloaf Recipes Sheet Pan Meatloaf 5.0 (4) 4 Reviews 4 Photos This meatloaf cooks in about 1 hour and has minimal cleanup required. It's perfect for a weeknight meal. Pair with three-ingredient macaroni and cheese, and a vegetable to round out this meal. Submitted by thedailygourmet Updated on November 27, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 10 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 pound ground beef 2 large eggs ¾ cup panko bread crumbs ¼ cup finely chopped onion ¼ cup BBQ sauce, divided 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 1 tablespoon garlic powder salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste cooking spray Directions Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Combine ground beef, eggs, bread crumbs, onion, 2 tablespoons BBQ sauce, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in large bowl and mix by hand. Line a sheet pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Shape meatloaf mixture evenly into a rectangular shape. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Brush with remaining BBQ sauce (or more as needed) and bake until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees C (73 degrees C), about 15 more minutes. Slice meatloaf and serve with extra BBQ sauce if desired. Cook’s Note I used my own recipe for homemade Boozy BBQ Sauce. The plastic rectangular container ground beef comes in is perfect to shape a meatloaf. Wash out the tray, and place the meatloaf mixture into the tray. Then invert on the foil lined baking sheet. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Meatloaf 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  triololr 08/03/2023 I used half and half Italian sausage and ground beef. I also added garlic powder onion powder and Italian seasoning. I skipped the barbecue sauce and used ketchup for the topping. 03 of 04 Photo by  Lindsay 07/26/2023 Excellent meatloaf! (And I’m not a huge meatloaf fan) The garlic is noticeable but not overdone. Loved the bbq in it and on top. Next time might even put more in the meatloaf. Great recipe! 04 of 04 Photo by  Paula 07/15/2023 I liked everything about this meatloaf - the firmness of it due to the panko and 2nd egg, the bbq flavor, and the garlic flavor (which I just knew was going to be too much but wasn’t at all!) I’d definitely make this again. 1 You’ll Also Love Best Meatloaf 1,126 Ratings Stovetop Stuffing Meatloaf 48 Ratings Garden Meatloaf 22 Ratings Classic Meatloaf 664 Ratings Mini Meatloaf Ghosts 13 Ratings Stuffing Meatloaf with a Sweet Glaze 4 Ratings Italian Mozzarella-Stuffed Meatloaf 12 Ratings Cottage Meatloaf 239 Ratings Wonderful Meatloaf 220 Ratings Kids Favorite Meatloaf 165 Ratings Simple Apricot-Glazed Meatloaf Recipe 14 Ratings Healthier Easy Meatloaf 18 Ratings My Meatloaf 168 Ratings Low-Carb Bacon-Wrapped Meatloaf 1 Rating Better Than Mom's Meatloaf 12 Ratings Halloween Zombie Meatloaf 38 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: thedailygourmet
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Combine ground beef, eggs, bread crumbs, onion, 2 tablespoons BBQ sauce, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in large bowl and mix by hand.;Line a sheet pan with foil and spray with cooking spray. Shape meatloaf mixture evenly into a rectangular shape.;Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Brush with remaining BBQ sauce (or more as needed) and bake until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees C (73 degrees C), about 15 more minutes.;Slice meatloaf and serve with extra BBQ sauce if desired.
